question: 搾る
sourceAnswer: to{} wring-(towel,-rag)/squeeze | squeeze-(fruit-to-extract-juice)/press/extract/milk/express-milk | rack-(one's-brains)/strain-(one's-voice) | extort/exploit | chew-out/reprimand-severely/rake-over-the-coals/give-a-sound-scolding/tell-someone-off/scold/rebuke | drill-into/train | narrow-down-(one's-focus)/whittle-down | gather-up-(curtain,-etc.)/tighten-(drawstring) | stop-down-(lens) | turn-down-(e.g.-radio) | bend-(bow)/draw | hold-down/constrict/immobilize
activeAnswer: to{} wring-(towel,-rag)/squeeze | squeeze-(fruit-to-extract-juice)/press/extract/milk/express-milk | rack-(one's-brains)/strain-(one's-voice) | extort/exploit | chew-out/reprimand-severely/rake-over-the-coals/give-a-sound-scolding/tell-someone-off/scold/rebuke | drill-into/train | narrow-down-(one's-focus)/whittle-down | gather-up-(curtain,-etc.)/tighten-(drawstring) | stop-down-(lens) | turn-down-(e.g.-radio) | bend-(bow)/draw | hold-down/constrict/immobilize
sourceMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>squeeze</kanji>, so the verb version is <vocabulary>to squeeze</vocabulary>. The way that this word differs from <ja>絞る</ja> is that <ja>絞る</ja> means "to wring out" and <ja>搾る</ja> means to squeeze or <vocabulary>to juice</vocabulary> fruits/vegetables or <vocabulary>to milk</vocabulary> a cow.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading.  You haven't learned this reading yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

After the farmer <vocabulary>milks</vocabulary> the cow, <reading>she bow</reading>s (<ja>しぼ</ja>) to the cow to say thank you for letting her <vocabulary>squeeze</vocabulary> out some fresh milk.
